result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

Defendant in custody.
State moves to dismiss and read in.  The defendant plead to charges of deliver Morphine and bail jumping in case no:  14 CF 329.  Motion granted.

Minutes.
Defendant's Notice of Motion; Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 05-21-14 at 2:30 p.m.  
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of operate without owner's consent.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 05-12-14 at 2:30 p.m. Bail is set at $1,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release and that he have no assaultive contact with Sandra Gleason.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
Minutes.
